reviews.sentence: Overall was nice. We were there for a Royals game. Great we could walk to the game. Everything at the Hotel was great except for the beds they were very uncomfortable.

Good if you are going to a ballgame otherwise find another hotel. This hotel is dated and has some interesting clientele. Upon check in there was a drunken card party directly across from the front desk and the ladies playing cards were so loud that I could not hear the front desk person. The hotel needs some TLC. The layout of the parking is not great. Noise from the bathroom in the next room indicated that there is zero insulation in the wall. Ie I could tell that it was a man urinating in the next room rather than a woman. On the positive side the bed and shower were good as is the case in all Sheraton hotels that I have visited. Price is good but you get what you pay for.

They went out of their way. The hotel employees were great. When we went to check in we were informed that even though I made my reservation back in February it was not in their system. They were not just fully booked but overboked. They did get us a room but at one point we were not sure it was going to happen. They called and got everything handled while I waited. I appreciated that. Others may have left it up to me to resolve.
Nice. We stayed there to go to the Chiefs game and it was a great time. The bed was great nice and comfortable. Very clean and walking distance to the sports complex. Would stay there again.
Nice. We stayed there to go to the Chiefs game and it was a great time. The bed was great nice and comfortable. Very clean and walking distance to the sports complex. Would stay there again.
Great sports location. Convenient and will stay here again.

Family enjoys stay at Four Points. The staff at the desk were very friendly and helpful. The housekeeper was nice also and took care of our needs extra towels. We liked the pool hours and the pool itself. Not really much for this area. Maybe having pool towels available. We had to ask for them several times.

Amazing Customer Service. Thank you DeDe for making us feel at home and being very friendly. She was very professional accommodating and always greeted us with a smile. The beds were very comfortable. The wifi was fast and efficient.
Nice hotel walking distance to the K.
Its an easy to find location and amazing if your a royals fan.

Close to Kaufman Stadium. I loved being able to walk across the street to see a Royals game. Looks like a Burger King is going in next door. that is probably a good thing since there is not a free breakfast. All in all this is a good hotel for the money. Close to the baseball park. As mentioned the Royals ballpark is just across the street. That was good. Would also be a good place to stay to see a Chiefs game. Would be nice to have a breakfast but not really a deal breaker. The restaurant is fine.

A interesting place. upon arrival we noticed bars holding the windows closed and on some of the windows spots like lotion. we got our room card and they did not work. Two wonderful maintenance men helped us and got our room door open. We did not expect much after our first impression of the outside of the hotel but once we got into our room it was cozy clean and the bed was soft. When we went down stair to ask about local eateries they gave us multiple places to eat. We asked where the pool was. they said lower level but it was closed for repairs and was not sure when it would be open. After eating we returned and decided to look at the pool area only to find it was open. ON the last morning we went down to eat breakfast. We thought is was free since every motel we have stayed at offered this. My husband had eggs and bacon with OJ. I had coffee. As we walked out a hotel staff person asked if we had a ticket. We said no. She went on to tell us breakfast cost 10 and some change. I said why was not this posted. there was nothing to indicate a price. Several others also argued the price. YOu need to post charges to your residents openly. They told us at the counter it was that price due to the buses of people and baseball cgroups. I could get more food and wait staff at the Denys 12 block away. That staff person was rude and demeaning treated us like we tried to skip on the bill. we wo nt be back.

Close to stadiums. It was an okay greeting at the desk. However we were not provided much info about the hotel and times of anything. We were given vague directions to our room. The room does not have information booklets about the hotel local eateries etc. And the bed is hard as a rock with extremely soft pillows.

The good the bad the ugly. location location locationRom clean beds very comfyRom looked out at the stadium. Emailed an earlier trip i had left my ice pack in the freezer. no answer was not found by my return tripI also called never got an answer left on holdChanged rooms. first one had an odorRm 2 handle came off the tub shower we could not change temp pressure or Turn Off. the water sink water pressure Too much toilet flush Ran for a very long time. something off with the plumbing packed up came homeStil no lighted signage on the street or building.

It met our very basic needs but not worth the money. The proximity to the stadium is really the only reason to stay here. I was with my 3 month old nephew and requested a crib. Was told that they did not have one only to see the cleaning lady using it as a laundry cart the next day. Really. The hotel can not afford to buy a proper laundry cart or buy an additional crib. Very disappointed in this. Also went to dinner at the restaurant and service was poor. We were the only customers and the staff was more interested in finding the game on TV than coming over to take our order. Once they finally took our order which was a chicken wrap and a club sandwich took forever. Also the club sandwich was literally not even toasted. Would not recommend this restaurant unles you are desperate.
Room was clean but not in great shape. Toilet ran all night and tub did nt drain. Not much for tv stations either. The restaurant food was great and employees were very friendly.

venue gouging at its finest. This hotel is in major need of renovation if not a complete tear down. The beds were comfortable and that s about all the positive I can say. I paid over 200 for a double room for the U2 concert and the room was not worth 50. The checkin staff was great. But the hallways smelled moldy. Even the kleenex box had wet tissues in it. The toilet handle was broke but fixed promptly. The door would hardly even close. The parking sucked. We would have been better off staying out a ways. Not what I expected for my money or the name. comfy beds. The location to the stadiums is awesome. Gas and fast food right there also. Easy access to the freeway. Almost everything could use some work.
Being across from the stadium you can tell it is just used and abused. Room was okay but nothing to write home about. Gets the job done if you need a place to crash.
Not your normal Four point standards. If your going to a sporting event good location. Other than that pick another hotel.

Close to Kansas City football baseball stadiums. Decent hotel. A little need for updating but bed was good and room clean. Very small bathroom. Toilet backed up and tub did not drain well BUT staff took care of it immediately very professional. Front desk was very nice pleasant. Hotel sports bar was ok as well food was good. No breakfast included in room rate not much of a continental one during the week would recommend a buffet breakfast in the restaurant. Overall nice place to stay if you just need a place to sleep. Decent place to sleep across street from major football baseball stadiums. Across street from major league football baseball stadiums. Breakfast buffet included with room rate.

High Crime Area. We met friends at the hotel who had both of their catalytic converters stolen from under their vehicle the one night we stayed. The camera pointing directly at the vehicle apparently was not recording and was for observation only. According to the staff no one was observing. Save your money and stay in a better part of Kansas City.

Very poor water pressure in the shower of R12 was missing a remote for TV maintenance provided a replacement. After 11 pm entry thru front only. One entry exit into hotel and congested. BUT Due to the age of the place Not bad.

Exceptional. Beds super comfortable room was modern and up to date. View was spectacular. Arrowhead stadium just a breath away. My kids spent hours in the pool and loved it. Check in and out was very easy. I had no issues at all and would gladly stay here again in the future.

First we are told in order to have a room on the same floor as our other guest we would have to switch from a king bed to 2 doubles. Then we get into our room and we have no refrigerator that our other room had and our safe is stuck shut and ca nt open it because they do nt have a key for there safes is stuck in the managers desk abd he is not anywhere close. Then we turn out our lights and our room is bright as hell because there is a spotlight hitting the ledge outside and we have bo darkening curtain. Will never stay at this hotel again. I strongly suggest you find a difrent hotel.
My husband and I spent the night here after Monday night football. Much nicer than the Adams Mark hotel. Will stay here every time now.

Worst experience I have ever had at a hotel. I will never go to another Sheraton or Mariot again due to the total lack of respect and concern offered by the employees. Owners and management should be embarrassed to even tell people they are associated with this hotel. Bugs check. Leaking air conditioner check. Dirty disgusting towel left in bathroom check. When I asked to talk to corporate management they told me they could not give me a number. I was taking my family to see their first baseball game and we missed the first inning after waiting 1 hour to check into one of the two rooms we had reserved. Four runs were scored that inning. Later when I complained I was informed that reservations do n’t really mean that your room is reserved it just means they will try and accommodate you. Please take my advice and stay anywhere but hear. I am being dead serious when I say a motel 6 is nicer and much more friendly. Also the positive reviews seem super fake to me I ’m sure they are just employees writing positive reviews. Nearly 40 one star reviews. This place is disgusting.

Prices were good for a holiday week. Housekeeping still managed to clean our room even though the hotel was sold out. I know some hotels will not clean your room if it is a holiday and they are completely booked unles you request it. The room was kind of small and so was the bathroom. The room could also stand to be updated a bit. It did not really strike me as a Sheraton hotel maybe Mariot will come in and revamp it. I had to wait for a front desk attendant but otherwise all the staff I encountered were so nice and helpful.

Nice but expected more from a Sheraton. Traveling with our old cat to see the folks in KC this Sheraton offered a choice of pillows with a SUPER AMAZINGLY comfortable bed although I wish all pet friendly hotels would block a small animals ability to move around underneath it. This should not be too much to ask given that they allocate pet rooms. We appreciated the little fridge for leftovers but missed having a microwave. The shower dispensed liquid soap etc but there was no tiny bar by the sink and the TVs remote was counter intuitive and outright stupid. no instruction found in the room. They did offer a breakfast buffet but it was no where near free. We thought their coffee was excellent and would however stay there again now knowing to take hand soap. Still it did not meet all our expectations of a fine hotel so I can not give it a 5 overall.

We were in town for a concert on september 8th. I assume that due to the concert the price per room was increased from average of 120 per night. We paid 340 for the same room. The location was cery convenient however the quality of the hitel rooms and staff was not worth 340. The restraunt was understaffed and had run out of certain menu items. We did nt get what we ordered and did not get good service for any drink refills or to even give our tab. The room ’s airconditioner was not working correctly and therefore everything was damp. The floor the sheets the towels. it was so humid in just the room that all of our clothes smelled musty by morning. The main door stuck so to open it we had to throw our shoulders into it and the door to the bathroom did nt lock. It was a terrible experience and i would not stay there again.

Horrible Gross you may as well book the local cheap by the hour motel it would be cheaper and you may feel cleaner in the morning. I booked this hotel off the Mariot Ap because I assume Mariot Locations are nice. It was the closest hotel to my appointments in the morning. The room smelled like mildew there were hairs in my sink from the last patron the toilet was running. There was a sign on the front desk stating that for safety reason the balconies on in the rooms could not be used. One can only assume that was because they were crumbling based on looks of them. I went to the front desk telling them I need to cancel my room. I do not regularly stay in crappy hotels and they said I had passed my cancellation period. I called Mariot Customer Service after 30 minutes. they could not find my reservation even after I gave them the confirmation number. I asked for a supervisor and they said there were no supervisors available. The recommended I speak to the front desk at the site. gosh do not you think I would have tried that first. Went to the Holiday Inn express 3 miles away. they upgraded me to a suite and greeted with a warm smile and a clean room.

Close to Arrowhead. It is an older hotel but clean. We stayed during a power outage so had no heat all afternoon and night. It would have been nice if they had comped part of our stay but they made no offer. Close to Arrowhead is a plus.
Check in was a mess. It was like they have never had a football game in town before. Lots of guests upset and waiting. They failed to plan for the rush and 540 game time.
The area appeared calm until I saw lots of traffic due to some event nearby. Also the hotel was under major renovation so this affected my assessment of it.
Beautiful evening to go to the Royals game and we were able to walk. Beds were very comfortable. Even though they were remodeling everyone was friendly and enjoyable.

Hotel looked nice at first glance but once inside the room it was very disappointing. We could hear EVERYTHING through the doors and walls TVs other guests the elevator ice machines we heard it all. When we went to shower we found the shower head was installed incredibly low I am 5 ft 5 in and I had to duck to wash my hair. To make matters worse it sounded like a large broken booster pump was tring to run throughout my shower behind the wall. Only saving grace was it was right across the street from the stadium. Not worth the money we paid for it though.

As a very frequent and loyal Mariot Bonvoy customer it saddens me to leave this review as I typically have great experiences in their propertiesbrThis was not a good experience best described as gross. Before completing my reservation I was aware that the location was “ under construction ” as they made it very clear on the Mariot Bonvoy booking site. What I did not expect was the disaster that the entire location was in including my room. Trash was all around the outside of the building albeit some was obvious construction materialbrI did a mobile check in from my phone and discovered nothing was done with it once I arrived and had to go through the normal check in process at the front desk not the end of the world but also not convenientbrI was greeted outside my room with a broken light fixture literally broken off the wall and Rug Doctor carpet cleaner plugged into the hallway wall right outside of my room it remained untouched and unmoved by the staff the entire time I was there. roughly 14 hours. I then walked into the room to find what appeared to be moldy door trim falling off the wall a light switch so filthy I would n’t touch it with my bare hands on a dare wallpaper bubbling off the walls electrical outlets protruding from the walls and a puddle of water in front of the bathroom toiletbrI expected much better from a Mariot Bonvoy location absolutely would not stay here again and borderline feel the need to get a tetanus shot after the stay. If there were another hotel available literally with any chain I would have gladly paid the cancellation fee here and moved locationsbrPictures included as I ’m not sure words can describe just how bad this place is.
Royals Sox game. Decent room for the price great location for a Royals game friendly staff.

The only good thing about this Hotel was the location. Right across the street from Kaufman Stadium. The hotel is very out dated and Old. It seemed like they had not done anything to it since it was built. The pool was closed for repairs the onsite Restaurant was closed during our 2 day stay. Breakfast was okay but not much to choose from. The staff was friendly and our room was clean. Bed was very uncomfortable they need to replace it. I felt like we were in a Motel 6. do not stay here.

What is going on. Charged me 500 extra for my stay. Said i broke a tv. Did no such thing. Wo nt reply to my calls or texts. Been staying at this location for many years. Used to be Holiday Inn Sports Complex. 1st time i have stayed since its been a Sheraton. Will probably be tge last. Unorganized 16 year old trying to run the reception area. Not his fault but room keys krpt failing. Lorraine in the lounge was great. Bartending cooking and trying to help with front desk. Feel bad for Lorraine and the 16 year old at the front desk.
Good. Everything was fine except the television cable was not working properly.
Oct 2019. Good place. Still in progress with the remodel but was not bad overall. The breakfast was good. Enter Exiting the facility onto main road was a challenge.
There was drunk people running up and down the halls slamming doors and yelling until 230 in the morning. My children had to be awake at 515 for a tournament. and nobody got any sleep.

Rudest Customer Service Ever. This was a horrible and very upsetting experience due explicitly to the front desk representative Joseph DI am a Best Western Rewards member and go out of my way to stay at their hotels. My family I are currently driving from Oregon to Ohio. We ’ve had pleasant experiences at our Best Western stays until tonight. Joseph D was so rude to me at check in that to call his behavior rude would be too kind. He was cruel and extremely insensitive. I’ve lodged an official complaint with corporate Best Western and will be speaking to the manager at this Best Western Barbara Cuty tomorrow morning when she is in. Hopefully she will take this matter seriously and take the appropriate action to remedy it. Joseph D ’s cruel and insensitive behavior concerned a service animal and his questioning and mean remarks around the disability our dog is needed for. Outside of that Joseph D was arrogant snappy and argumentative. While the hotel is nice minus the fact that only one of the elevators is working I would not recommend this particular Best Western. In fact avoid it at all costs if Joseph D is working. If proper action is n’t taken this will be the last time I stay at any Best Western and I have been a decades long customer. An update No manager or anyone from BW has been in touch. We will be staying at The Drury Inn for the remainder of this trip and will be switching our reward membership to them. BW just lost a damn good customer.
newly renovated modern fresh and great location. Would be super for sports events a bit quiet during the week.
Location is great right across from Arrowhead stadium. Bed and pillows are very comfortable. Staff is friendly. Free breakfast which was pretty good except for the bacon it was not very tasty.

Worst Experience Ever. The only good part was getting the room earlier than we thought and not having to leave our bags in a car for hours while we were at the football game. The check in was fine as we did not have a room available until 4. We were in town for the football game this weekend and thought we would have to check in after as we were waiting to head to the game the lady at the desk advised she had a room ready am hour and a half earlier which was great. The bad parts of the stay was while we were waiting for our room we stopped to have lunch in the Boulevard Cafe there was one wait staff for a room of about 40 fans here for the football game. When we finally caught her attention we asked for a menu to which we were told they have none and she rattled off a choice of burgers fries onion rings and moz sticks. After putting in an order for cheeseburgers moz sticks and onion rings she came back with one cheeseburger and a hamburger with two orders of fries and the saddest looking moz stick I have ever seen. After advising that we had two cheeseburgers she asked could she just brung us a slice of cheese and she did a cold slab of cheese on a napkin. Which was the only napkin we recieved at our table no sliverware no straws for our drinks etc. She was clearly undertsafed as she came to our table several times to give us orders for other people even after we had our food. we had to send the moz sticks back as the cheese was cold and still half frozen in the middle worse tab I ever paid in my life the food was so bad during lunch we opted to not use our free breakfast coupons this morning and are instead looking elsewhere for better food. On to the room as we entered it was very chilly and thought maybe the furnace just needed to warm up so we increased the temp and left out for the game. Not the case after spending 4 hours in the cold 30 degree temps at the game we came back to the furnace still blowing cold air. Went to the front desk and a new lady advised she would send maintenance.

Worst Experience Ever. The only good part was getting the room earlier than we thought and not having to leave our bags in a car for hours while we were at the football game. The check in was fine as we did not have a room available until 4. We were in town for the football game this weekend and thought we would have to check in after as we were waiting to head to the game the lady at the desk advised she had a room ready am hour and a half earlier which was great. The bad parts of the stay was while we were waiting for our room we stopped to have lunch in the Boulevard Cafe there was one wait staff for a room of about 40 fans here for the football game. When we finally caught her attention we asked for a menu to which we were told they have none and she rattled off a choice of burgers fries onion rings and moz sticks. After putting in an order for cheeseburgers moz sticks and onion rings she came back with one cheeseburger and a hamburger with two orders of fries and the saddest looking moz stick I have ever seen. After advising that we had two cheeseburgers she asked could she just brung us a slice of cheese and she did a cold slab of cheese on a napkin. Which was the only napkin we recieved at our table no sliverware no straws for our drinks etc. She was clearly undertsafed as she came to our table several times to give us orders for other people even after we had our food. we had to send the moz sticks back as the cheese was cold and still half frozen in the middle worse tab I ever paid in my life the food was so bad during lunch we opted to not use our free breakfast coupons this morning and are instead looking elsewhere for better food. On to the room as we entered it was very chilly and thought maybe the furnace just needed to warm up so we increased the temp and left out for the game. Not the case after spending 4 hours in the cold 30 degree temps at the game we came back to the furnace still blowing cold air. Went to the front desk and a new lady advised she would send maintenance.

Yeah for whatever reason. When I was getting an Uber. When I put in QuikTrip. It kept putting me over there at the Best Western. And the Uber driver would get lost every time. I mean maybe they should stop hogging all the GPS. Locations you know.

This could easily be a higher score. I did not stay the night so this is just based on the banquet servives. The food served at the banquet was mediocre and lukewarm. The salad had been frozen as the lettuce and veggies were wilted. Even the coffee was bland brewed too weak to have any flavor. The table cloths were dirty as well as many of the glasses and plates. Just an overall underwhelming experience. The lobby looked very nice updated and clean. The bathrooms were also very clean.

Paid for balcony but nailed shut. The breakfast buffet in the morning had good variation. It was nice to have a hot breakfast. The staff was kind. We upgraded to a balcony room for the balcony. We get to our room and the door is nailed shut. After speaking with the front desk they told us they very recently they nailed every balcony door shut but provided no reasoning behind it. We spoke with corporate because we paid extra for a balcony and are expecting a call back in a day or two. Hopefully they will make good on the situation. The other downfall was that it took 5 minutes not even an exaggeration to get warm water going in the shower. Last thing there was some kind of grease spots or something on the ceiling in our room.
